reviews.review_msg: The course itself was really great and you will learn a lot about the tools. You have to do a lot search and ask TAs questions to do well on the project. The prof is tough and sometimes hard to approach.
Course material is invaluable!  The project portion is awesome!

A project class where there exists 2 worlds, the lecture and the project, where the lectures go over everyone's heads since the project is the real star of the show. Topics are disconnected and lacks practicality. Project gives lots of freedom and expect lots of self-study. Choice of TA is just as important as her for such a project-based class.

Best and most important course for CMPT ENSC student. Making your own FPGA project from pure metal. Basically this is the capstone course for CMPT ENSC student where you could show your knowledge through these 4-5 years of college life. Everyone need to spend around 30hrs/W in the lab and basically everyone feels really worth it at the end.
Expect a 10 page final exam. Labs are heavy and time consuming that happens every few weeks. Memorize lecture slides for her exams - really helpful.
She is so good, her exams are easy, as well as all assignements. I think she should raise the diffculty of exam.
doesn't release grade on time.
Insanely hard. if you dont pay attention your failed
she is so boring and instructions in the lab are not clear

She's unbelievably tough and expects us to know way more than I can even find on google. Although if you showed up to class and signed the sign in sheet, she may shift the midterm weight to the final so instead of 25 and 50 it's 0 and 75
Even in the last lecture she is still teaching new stuff but not reviewing.
Assignments are vague and tedious, not really relating to course material. Frustrating in lecture but the tests are based off of them and what she emphasizes in class.

Course material is not hard but her lectures make it harder for us to understand. Lab requirements are extremely vague at first, and other assignments are based on the first one. Final assignment is hard like hell. BTW 70% of students in her class failed the midterm, and she said she won't scale because she is the UCC chair of the faculty.
extremely hard because she don't scale the course and she love to ask compare and contrast question, be prepare for that on the midterm. Not sure about the final
89 people failed and 105 students have to retake base on current score out of 152 students. Amazing.

You have to call her Dr. Shannon. Lectures are long, boring and useless, i would rather read textbooks and google the stuff. Lab requirements are extremely unclear and ironically, she requires us to do the lab using MS Visual Studio, but upload the final result in Linux form. Overall, she does not teach. And there is no TA during the lab.

I'm glad finally people are realizing how bad a prof Lesley is. You have to be completely blind and isolated to think there's slightly anything good in her teaching. Lesley does not TEACH! She just babbles! You are all doomed once u go to work and find out how much firmware/digital students from other schools know compared to you.
I can say is, she is bad prof

You will learn anything in this class, from Google and other source. NOT from LESLEY! Her lecture seems to be organized but actually not. The way she represents it is just horrible. And seriously, Lesley, if you can't draw or write, why don't you just prepare a printed note instead? Well, She's just a little bit better than Craig

ANYthing you learn in her class is from self study and your own work! The course load is more than 4 credits, and she is very annoying in her lectures! Her notes are insufficient and if you miss a class you will lose at least 3-5% of your exams since there are no notes! Don't make her angry or she will give you Hell...

She's not a good prof. She is very annoying in class. I am not sure why people think they learn a lot from her. She just throws this big project at you, and you are on your own to teach the whole course to yourself. At the end you learn, but not from her!
Good teacher, but arrogant and annoying.  Likes to belittle students.  If you can ignore all of that, you'll learn a lot from her.

While I agree that she can be annoying sometimes, I thought she really good teacher.  She put a lot of work into the class, assignments gave us actual experience that will be useful later.  Learned more *useful* things from her than any other prof at SFU.  Really cares about her students.
There were many times i thought about shooting myself in the head while sitting in her lectures. Believe me, you will too!

NO, SHE IS NOT A GREAT PROF at allll. Just because she gave you an easy A, doesn't make her a good prof. You don't learn anything from her. She is really annoying in lectures. All she does is try to show off about how smart and experienced she is (she's not). Worst sense of humor: sarcastic-goofy-arrogant-obnoxious  way ....
Great Prof
She tries hard, but the way she teaches is nothing but useless. He exams are kind of difficult.
Great prof.  You will learn a lot from her, and it will all be completely relevant for the real world.  Knows more than any of the other profs in Engineering Science about real engineering...
the exams are from her lectures but her lectures are not enough to learn for real life "REAL TIME PROGRAMMING" , I found the labs very useful , in order to do well attend all the lectures

the worst prof even. just BS all the time during the class. Not much of the lecture mateials are related to the labs, and the labs are really time comsuming. Definitelly, avoid her if u can. If u want to have  a feeling how bad she is, come to AQ 3159 on Monday 8:30 to 10:30 or AQ 4150 on Wed 9:30 to 10:30
Very limited knowledge...knows a few things, fakes the rest.She's hot, though.

One of the best professors in SFU Engineering. She is very enthusiastic, and trying to make the class fun. Her lecture notes are clear, but you should attend her lectures to understand them quickly. Preview of the lecture notes is highly recommended. The amount of work for lab was quite a lot, but as long as you know the stuff, you can handle them.

I can confidently say that Lesley is one of the best professors in SFU Engineering. Compared to other teachers such as Atousa, it's like the difference between night and day. You can tell by her enthusiasm and her ability to present information to students.
She is one of the worst profs ever. Always confused when teaching. She might be better than Craig, but it doesn't count, anyone does better than Craig. she might be good for a high school course.

One of the best profs in engineering dept who knows her stuff and knows how to convey it to students. Very helpful, give hints for test questions and gives some bonus questions. If you want to do really well in her course, attend her lectures and understand her lecture slides and you will get B+ and above easily...Highly recommended to take course
Very energetic and enthusiastic teacher. Fair grader. I would recommend her over Craig.
